Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
graded \graded\ adj. 1. ordered by some quantitative ranking; as, Reading tests of graded difficulty.
Syn: ordered, ranked. [WordNet 1.5]
2. leveled and drained but not paved; -- of roads.
Syn: graveled. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Grade \Grade\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Graded}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Grading}.] 1. To arrange in order, steps, or degrees, according to size, quality, rank, etc. [1913 Webster]
2. To reduce to a level, or to an evenly progressive ascent, as the line of a canal or road. [1913 Webster]
3. (Stock Breeding) To cross with some better breed; to improve the blood of. [1913 Webster]
graded adj : arranged in a sequence of grades or ranks; "stratified areas of the distribution" [syn: {ranked}, {stratified}]
